title: Susan Lloyd-Hurwitz can afford a Mirvac flat white or two
text:
Mirvac chief Susan Lloyd-Hurwitz's purchase of a property in the company's prestigious and highly sought-after Eastbourne development was first reported yonks ago. But now, we finally know what she paid: a mere $770,500, according to Saturday's The Australian.

Which, frankly, makes her revelation at this newspaper's Property Summit on Thursday all the more extraordinary.

Susan Lloyd-Hurwitz found securing a mortgage on a $770,000 property "torturous". James Alcock

"Personally I just settled myself and it was a very painful process. It's torturous," the property chief said.

"People tell us about being assessed on how many coffees they drink. It can get nonsensical about how much scrutiny there is."

Lloyd-Hurwitz earned $4.8 million in statutory remuneration in FY19, fully half in cash. Earlier this month, she came into a further $220,317.18 from selling 70,967 Mirvac stapled securities on-market. Point being: it'd take a lot of coffees to bite into that!
description: "Personally I just settled myself and it was a very painful process," said the Mirvac chief, paid $5 million a year, about securing a mortgage.
